hi john, maybe this is not the best way to approach you for such simple questionI have regarding angular.

on ng-demos/modular you initialize the routes of each module in the .run block instead of in the .config block, I do know the difference of execution between those two blocks.

But most examples or docs out there define routes in the .config block.

Where is the advantage of doing it in the run block? is there some performance advantage trying to initialize routes only when the actual app module is run? i guess..

well hope you can enlighten me.

sorry to disturb you on this channel.

great angular knowledge you have, thanks for sharing
